title: Quantum Leap Social Network
description: A social network exclusively for time travelers. The user base was difficult to acquire due to temporal paradoxes and the fact that most users hadn't been born yet.

attempts.description: Initial launch. The platform worked, but the chicken-and-egg problem was magnified by non-linear timelines. Gained a user in 2042 who complained about the 'retro' UI.

title: AI-Powered Pet Translator
description: A collar that translates your pet's barks and meows into plain English. Unfortunately, it turns out most pets just want to talk about food, naps, and squirrels.

attempts.description: Prototype v1. Used a Raspberry Pi. The translation algorithm was 90% accurate but the insights were 100% boring.
Sleeker collar design. Added a 'deep thoughts' filter, which was just a random philosophy quote generator. Users were not fooled.
Pivoted to translating squirrels. This was a technical success but a commercial and existential nightmare.

title: Blockchain To-Do List
description: A decentralized to-do list app where every task is a non-fungible token (NFT). Users found the gas fees for adding 'buy milk' to the blockchain were prohibitively expensive.

attempts.description: Launched on the Ethereum mainnet. The concept of 'immutably pending' tasks was confusing, and the cost to check off a task sometimes exceeded the cost of the item on the list.

title: DevCrush
description: A dating site exclusively for software developers, aiming to connect people through shared technical interests and late-night coding sessions.

attempts.description: Initial concept and prototype. The idea was deemed a bit silly and ultimately abandoned due to the founder not having enough time to dedicate to the project.

title: JobPilot â€“ Automated Job Submission Engine
description: A system that saves job application links manually through an 'Add' button and later auto-fills and auto-submits all applications using a master profile. Designed to eliminate repetitive login and form-filling across different job platforms by running scheduled apply sessions. The platform attempts to fully automate job submission while navigating legal and ToS-related constraints.
reasons_for_failure: Full auto-submit introduces ToS and legal complications
Complexity in handling different ATS, forms, and security flows
Auto Login automation blocked by OTP/CAPTCHA
